4 queries search time: 1.7259166666666668 min


I set miu = 2000, since the slide of Unit 5 saids: the optimal prior miu seems to vary from collection to collection, though in most cases, it is around 2000. The relative weighting of terms is emphasized when we use a smaller. It can also be shown that when miu approaches zero, the scoring formula is dominated by the count of matched terms. As miu gets very large, however, it is more complicated due to the length normalization term, and it is not obvious what terms would dominate the scoring formula.
